entry.title: [Nearby Presence] Add Credential Storage to Shared Remotes.
entry.content:
To provide access to NearbyPresenceCredentialStorage to

the sandboxed utility process, this CL adds plumbing to

NearbyDependencyProvider and SharingImpl. These dependencies

are consumed by the utility process so that the

platform implementation can access the browser process'

interface.



Added CredentialStorageInitializer to be owned and initialized

by NearbyDependencyProvider. Added related plumbing

to SharingImpl to bind the Remote to the Receiver provided

by the dependency provider.



A full design doc

is available at go/cros-nearby-presence-credential-storage.



flag enabled. No risk in landing as code is guarded.

entry.title: Revert "IDB: add/improve some performance metrics."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 01bbf51922127e13c5255f529c71366f65d322fb.



Reason for revert: crbug.com/1513609 IndexedDBBrowserTest.ObjectStoreTest failing on Mac-11



Original change's description:

> IDB: add/improve some performance metrics.

>

> The long-existing Transaction.*.TimeActive metric starts measuring from

> when a transaction "starts" and stops measuring when it's half way

> through committing, i.e. when done writing blobs (if any), but not done

> with the LevelDB commit. Not clear if this was intentional, but it's

> being replaced by `TimeActive2` which measures until after the LevelDB

> commit finishes, which should better capture differences between

> backing stores (e.g. LevelDB vs SQLite) as well as the effects of

> relaxed durability.

>

> A new renderer metric is added that measures the time taken to open a

> database, which can either be establishing a new connection to an

> existing database or creating a new database. This is an important

> aspect of read performance which the `ObjectStoreGet` metric fails to

> measure since it doesn't start measuring until the transaction is

> already active. `open` delays could be affected by IDB thread

> contention (crbug.com/1474996) or database lock contention, i.e.

> those resources guarded by PartitionedLockManager; relaxing

> durability should generally shorten the duration for which locks are

> held, so hopefully this metric demonstrates a difference in that

> experiment.

>

> A new browser metric, Transaction.*.TimeQueued, measures the time

> spent in the transaction queue before starting. Like the new renderer

> metric, this should capture "traffic jams" from lock or thread

> contention.

>

> Bug: 1474996,965883,1429650

> Change-Id: I90c73e5eade72d2f183998729203ce1aa9fc241a

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5136998

> Commit-Queue: Evan Stade

> Reviewed-by: Ayu Ishii

> Reviewed-by: Chris Harrelson

> Auto-Submit: Evan Stade

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1239867}

entry.title: [Office upload] Handle escape key as a "cancel" in Move Confirmation
entry.content:
Handle the escape keydown event as a "cancel" user choice in the Move

Confirmation dialog.



Previously, an escape keydown event would close this dialog with an

empty user choice. This led to weird metric results as an empty user

choice (which is never expected) would be recorded and mistakenly

translated to the user choosing an invalid local file task.



Update the code so that an escape in the Move Confirmation dialog will

correctly be recorded as a "cancel" user choice. And expect that all

user responses are non-empty as now all CloudUploadDialogs that call

CloudOpenTask::OnDialogComplete() handle Escape. Those dialogs are:

- File Handler dialog [1]

- Setup flow dialogs [2]

- Move Confirmation dialog (this CL)



Add keydown event listeners on the document in connectedCallback() and

explicitly remove them in disconnectedCallback(). They have to be

removed as otherwise they will be called upon keydown events after they

have been removed from the DOM.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5124953

[2] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4054757



Bug: b/315727684

Change-Id: I55e28910477cee648e3d33449170de3b821d820a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5143546

Reviewed-by: Peter Marshall

Commit-Queue: Cassy Chun-Crogan

entry.title: [Office upload] Handle escape key as a "cancel" in Connect to OneDrive
entry.content:
Handle the escape keydown event as a "cancel" user choice in the Connect

to OneDrive dialog.



Previously, an escape keydown event would close this dialog with an

empty user choice. This didn't have an impact as the user choice is

ignored but this should be fixed in case it is relied upon in the

future.



Update the code so that an escape in the Connect to OneDrive dialog will

correctly be recorded as a "cancel" user choice. Also hardcode

CloudUploadDialog::ShouldCloseDialogOnEscape() to always return True as

now all CloudUploadDialogs handle Escape.



Add keydown event listeners on the document in connectedCallback() and

explicitly remove them in disconnectedCallback(). They have to be

removed as otherwise they will be called upon keydown events after they

have been removed from the DOM.

entry.title: [Office upload] Handle Escape keydown in Setup Cancel dialog
entry.content:
The Setup Cancel dialog opens when the user clicks the Cancel button or

presses Escape during the Setup flow. But since Escape was not handled

in the Setup Cancel dialog, the default webui behaviour of just closing

without any special behaviour [1] occurs upon an Escape here.



Update the code so that the Escape keydown triggers the Setup Cancel

dialog to be properly closed i.e. it is equivalent to the user clicking

the Continue button and resuming the Setup flow.



Add keydown event listeners on the document in connectedCallback() and

explicitly remove them in disconnectedCallback(). They have to be

removed as otherwise they will be called upon keydown events after they

have been removed from the DOM. Do this for the Setup Cancel dialog as

well as for the Setup flow dialogs as even though the Escape was

previously handled here, the listener was not properly removed.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/web_dialogs/web_dialog_delegate.h;l=169;drc=8e78783dc1f7007bad46d657c9f332614e240fd8

entry.title: [Tracing w/SDK] enable async socket connection in sandboxed processes
entry.content:
This CL enables async socket connection when system tracing is enabled

in sandboxed child processes. The async socket connection makes a mojo

request to open the producer socket in the browser process and receives

the open socket handle from the mojo response.



The implementation of connecting the producer socket is migrated to use

socket syscalls directly without using perfetto::base::UnixSocket.



Bug: b/245116106



Change-Id: I441132d622bc31194136d3e764cf8c50ffdece1a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5057031

entry.title: [Code Health] Remove some uses of base::SupportsWeakPtr. (11)
entry.content:
This CL removes base::SupportsWeakPtr as a base class of

feedback::FeedbackUploader by doing the following:



1. Adding a pure virtual member function to FeedbackUploader that

returns base::WeakPtr called AsWeakPtr.

2. Implementing that virtual function in the derived classes.

3. Changing uses of base::AsWeakPtr to call to the virtual function.



This CL is complicated by the fact that there are numerous test/mock

implementations of FeedbackUploader that likely don't need this

functionality. However, it seems safer and more future-proof to

implement a WeakPtrFactory for those classes.



There is also one test that uses FeedbackUploader directly, but

since that's now an abstract base class, it's necessary to implement

a trivial class to provide the AsWeakPtr override.



Bug: 647430

Change-Id: Ie49a9dc9ce2450bf002b921d3cdde1fa13923b58

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5106831

Reviewed-by: Xiangdong Kong

Reviewed-by: Tommy Nyquist

Commit-Queue: David Bertoni

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1239982}

entry.title: Enable verbatimModuleSyntax compiler option
entry.content:
This allows us to keep similar behaviour to the deprecated

importsNotUsedAsValues flag by replacing it with

verbatimModuleSyntax which is 5.0 compatible.



Remove const enum for verbatimModuleSyntax compiler option.

The compiler does not allow unit tests to access these types

with verbatimModuleSyntax enabled, so we turn them back into

values by removing const.



Bug: b:276513137

Change-Id: Ic58acca607a531035cf60061787a1efdea1f8562

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4852780

Reviewed-by: Wenbo Jie

Commit-Queue: Peter Marshall

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1239981}

entry.title: Take **`const`** `SharedBuffer` in `SegmentReader::CreateFrom...`.
entry.content:
This change is motivated by 2 things:



* It is in general desirable to express `const` guarantees in the type

system. And `blink::SegmentReader`'s doc comment explicitly says that

it is a read-only interface.

* Hypothetical future C++/Rust FFI looks nicer when calling C++

functions and methods that take `const` references.



This change only affects `SegmentReader::CreateFromSharedBuffer`

because:



* This is what unit tests use in a prototype of Rust interop.

* Adding `const` to other methods (e.g. changing the return type of

`SegmentReader::GetAsSkData` from `sk_sp` to `sk_sp
SkData>`) seems to require a **lot** of cascading, viral changes.



Bug: 1471546

Change-Id: Ia46bb45945fab19b6f2f1bb38ee79d9028c4544d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5142427

Reviewed-by: Urvang Joshi

Commit-Queue: Åukasz Anforowicz

entry.title: WebUI: Return error instead of empty response in SanitizedImageSource.
entry.content:
Previously any errors in processing chrome://image/ requests would

result in an empty, but otherwise "successful", response. Responding

with an error is better because it surfaces such errors in DevTools such

that they are more likely to be noticed.



Bug: 1512945

Change-Id: I1e8993e80de15b0293d41f99b558587469786fc2

entry.title: Fix Battery Saver and Adaptive Charging search
entry.content:
There is a race between PowerSection initialization and the first

PowerStatus event from PowerManagerClient. If PowerSection is

initialized before the first PowerStatus, then BatterySaverController

IsBatterySaverSupported will assume it is not because PowerManagerClient

GetLastStatus returns nullopt. A similar problem happens with adaptive

charging.



This CL moves the AddSearchTags calls for battery saver and adaptive

charging to be in PowerChanged, so we know that there is a valid

PowerStatus.



Bug: b:316202939

Test: Manually search for "Battery Saver" and "Adaptive Charging", cq

entry.title: Make destructor of `WTF::SharedBuffer` private (friend of `RefCounted`)
entry.content:
This CL helps to ensure that `WTF::SharedBuffer` can only be destructed

via `base::RefCounted` (e.g. that `SharedBuffer` cannot be

stack-allocated).



One motivation for this CL is a future, hypothetical Rust interop, which

may need to provide an explicit comment with a justification of why an

`unsafe impl RefCounted for wtf::SharedBuffer` won't undermine Rust

memory safety.

entry.title: Add DWOC to see if CCBCEP::CanCommitURL() still needs the PRIV_EXTENSION exception.
entry.content:
ChromeContentBrowserClientExtensionsPart::CanCommitURL() has an escape

hatch that allows extensions not registered in the ProcessMap to

commit in any extension process. This fixed a renderer kill that was

happening in the early days of site isolation (see

https://crbug.com/840857#c12). It shouldn't be needed anymore, since

site isolation for extensions (which shipped a few years after this

kill was happening) now guarantees that each extension can only commit

in a process locked to that extension, and multiple extensions can

never share a process. Add a DumpWithoutCrashing() call to confirm

whether this is still happening in the wild, to see if this early

return can be removed.



Bug: 1506082, 840857

Change-Id: Iea594a0208ec46ec28817f35c10c295a63d4d55a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5142294

Reviewed-by: David Bertoni

Commit-Queue: Alex Moshchuk

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1239949}

entry.title: Send mouse release events when drag and drop finished.
entry.content:
Normal mouse events are suppressed during drag and drop. We should

send the current button states when d&d is finished so that client

has the correct button state.



Without this, a right/middle button state can stuck, which prevents

certain click actions.



Bug: 1513068, 1445759

entry.title: [omnibox][ml] No longer identify matches stripped_destination_url.
entry.content:
This CL refactors the ML scoring code to no longer rely on

ACMatch::stripped_destination_url for identifying the eligible matches.

The ML scoring API returns the predictions in the same order it

received the scoring signals and due to its synchronous nature the

matches are guaranteed to not have changed.



Fixed: 1446688

entry.title: WebUI: Include Lit in prod builds and exclude Lit bundle in bundle_js().
entry.content:
This is in preparation of starting a gradual cr_elements migration to

Lit. Currently limiting the visibility of

//third_party/lit/v3_0:build_ts to ui/webui/resources/cr_elements/.



Note: bundle_js() logic has currently a limitation when it comes to

excluding external paths (it can do so correctly for prefix paths, but

not for complete paths). Adding an assertion to catch such cases, and

using a prefix external path for Lit (chrome://resources/lit/v3_0/) to workaround the problem for now, even though only a single file is

actually ever used (chrome://resources/lit/v3_0/lit.rollup.js).

entry.title: Don't send IME Candidate selection a11y event in autocomplete suggestion
entry.content:
Sending an event when showing autocomplete suggestion will distrupt

user's typing for ChromeVox users.



This change:

- Adds |is_user_selecting| flag to CandidateWindow.

- Let our binding to infer the flag for now. TODO is to plumb it from

the extension.

- Makes CandidateView and CandidateWindowView dispatch an accessibility

event only when user is actually choosing item from the candidates.



This is a part of http://go/chromevox-jp-ime.



Bug: b:259380284, b:259379909, b:300576550

Test: CandidateWindowViewTest, InputMethodEngineTest, SpokenFeedbackWithCandidateWindowTest

entry.content:

$ git log cd9486849..a5ab5b2b8 --date=short --no-merges --format='%ad %ae %s'

2023-12-20 estade Amalgamations for release 3.44.2

2023-11-24 Version 3.44.2

2023-11-23 Another assertion fault fix, similar to [a9443dbfbe25e588].

2023-11-23 Fix harmless compiler warnings in debugging code.

2023-11-23 Fix an fts5 problem that could occur when mixing regular and secure delete operations on a single table.

2023-11-23 Increase the version number to 3.44.2.

2023-11-23 larrybr Fix output redirect bug reported in [forum:/forumposts/cbf4933cfeee74bb|the forum].

2023-11-22 stephan Correct the URL for loading sqlite3-worker1-bundler-friendly.mjs from sqlite3-worker1-promiser-bundler-friendly.js, so that the promiser can be used in bundler-using environments. Problem reported via email.

2023-11-22 Version 3.44.1

2023-11-21 larrybr Pickup minor stylistic changes related to console I/O and, for Windows builds, get fact of UTF-16 translation into the sign-on banner. (a straight cherry-pick)

2023-11-20 Back out an incorrect change to the sqlite3ExprCompareSkip() function from long ago.

2023-11-20 larrybr Arrange to not compile unused console I/O function.

2023-11-20 Convert an assert in OP_VCheck into a branch that aborts the opcode, as this can happen on some very obscure conditions, as discovered by dbsqlfuzz.

2023-11-20 Cherry pick additional assert() fixes from trunk into the branch-3.44 branch.

2023-11-20 Fix an assert() in fts5 that could be true following an OOM or IO error in contentless-delete mode.

2023-11-19 larrybr Fix test 5.0 in shell1.test for Windows. (A double-quote wrapped single-quote needs no further treatment to be recognized as a single single-quote.)

2023-11-18 Correct conditional compilation issue seen with MSVC in the Win32 mutex subsystem.

2023-11-16 larrybr Cherrypick changes to simplify and make more rational how console I/O package features are selected.

2023-11-15 larrybr Get Fiddle build to succeed. (It runs, too, but not from changes here.)

2023-11-15 larrybr Changes to console I/O for Fiddle build, to always defer to C library (as before.) A WIP, pending testing with Fiddle build.

2023-11-14 larrybr Cherry-pick some assert()s to cover misuse of *Put*() from 500+ shell.c callers.

2023-11-13 larrybr Manual merge of branch-3.44 with 3 sources affected/created by console-io-lib changes.

2023-11-13 Remove an incorrect ALWAYS() and NEVER().

2023-11-10 Fix another problem with mixed join types and the RIGHT JOIN strength-reduction optimization.

2023-11-10 Fix an obscure problem with the join-strength-reduction optimization that could occur when mixing LEFT and RIGHT joins in the same query.

2023-11-10 stephan Expose the missing SQLITE_SUBTYPE to wasm.

2023-11-09 Ensure 8-byte alignment of data structues in sqlite3_database_file_object().

2023-11-09 stephan Expose SQLITE_RESULT_SUBTYPE to wasm.

2023-11-09 Add the SQLITE_RESULT_SUBTYPE flag for application-defined functions. Add the -DSQLITE_STRICT_SUBTYPE=1 compile-time option that raises an error if any function invokes sqlite3_result_subtype() without the SQLITE_RESULT_SUBTYPE flag. SQLITE_RESULT_SUBTYPE prevents an indexed value of that function from being used to replace an equivalent expression, since the indexed expression does not carry the subtype.

2023-11-09 JSON5 bug fix: Escape double-quotes that occur inside of single-quoted strings.

2023-11-07 Update the documentation to the sqlite3_set_auxdata() and sqlite3_get_auxdata() routines to make it clear that they do not work as one might expect when they are called during query planning, instead of during query execution. The JSON routines misuse those interfaces, so add a special flag to JSON routines that prevents them from being invoked during query planning.

2023-11-06 Update the srctree-check.tcl script and child script so that they can be run on a read-only source tree and so that if any inconsistencies are found, the script returns a non-zero exit code and thus halts the build.

2023-11-06 Fix an fts5 problem where a transaction consisting of (a) a DELETE on rowid X, (b) a prefix query, and (c) an INSERT on rowid X, could corrupt the index.

2023-11-02 Update the version number to 3.44.1

2023-11-02 CLI to compile with older MSVC compiler.

2023-11-01 Version 3.44.0

2023-10-31 Fix harmless compiler warnings in test code.

2023-10-31 Dan Kennedy Fix a problem with SQLITE_ENABLE_FTS5 builds of the non-amalgamation testfixture.exe in Makefile.msc.

2023-10-30 Update the autoconf/Makefile.msc so that it aligns with Makefile.msc.

2023-10-30 larrybr Dodge a nuisance warning from MSVC in CLI use of Prepared Statement Scan Status. (Yes, C rules are fine.)

2023-10-30 Add a cast to i64 for an integer in an sqlite3OsWrite() offset calculation. The cast is not strictly necessary, but it helps human readers see that the code is correct.

2023-10-30 Fix another comment typo. No code changes.

2023-10-30 Make the new sqlite3_get_clientdata() and sqlite3_set_clientdata() interfaces available to run-time loaded extensions.

2023-10-30 Dan Kennedy Fix problems with previous commit on Makefile.msc. Also some win32-specific test failures in fts5misc.test.

2023-10-30 Fix typo in a comment. No code changes.

2023-10-30 Dan Kennedy Add FTS5 to default Makefile.msc builds. And UNKNOWN_SQL_FUNCTION and STMT_SCANSTATUS to default Makefile.msc shell builds.

2023-10-30 larrybr Predicate Windows CLI UTF-8 console I/O on a runtime capability check rather than an OS version check.

2023-10-30 With SQLITE_ENABLE_BLOCK_ATOMIC_WRITE enabled, if a transaction is committing and there is a new freelist page at the end of the database file which would cause the database file size to grow, ensure that page is written and the file size grows before the block-atomic-write commits. Fix for the problem identified by [forum:/forumpost/3bd8d497b2|forum post 3bd8d497b2]

2023-10-29 larrybr Simplify code slightly. Improve comments on added code and its use.

2023-10-29 larrybr Properly close a handle. Use a putatively effective runtime test for UTF-8 console I/O capability. (This makes the version test useful mainly for avoiding a warning that UTF-8 console I/O could not be setup.)

(...)

2023-08-24 stephan Do not pre-allocate sqlite3_aggregate_context() for Java UDFs, as it unduly complicates UDF initialization.

2023-08-24 Dan Kennedy Add doc/testrunner.md, for documenting the testrunner.tcl script.

2023-08-24 stephan More code legibility and style improvements in the JNI pieces. Start work on a javadoc build.

2023-08-24 stephan Doc, code style, and legibility cleanups.

2023-08-24 stephan Doc style fixes.

2023-08-24 stephan Add a new non-goal to the JNI README.md.

2023-08-24 stephan Correct JNI layer's misuse of an sqlite3-internal error-reporting API (no mutex held). Style cleanups. Eliminate lookups of per-thread state by approximately 85% across the test suite.

2023-08-24 stephan Ensure that db mutex is held when using sqlite3ErrorWithMessage() to avoid a potential assertion in debug builds.

2023-08-24 stephan Add more JNI docs, tests, and a handful of Java-side overloads.

2023-08-23 stephan JNI cleanups regarding building with certain features disabled.

2023-08-23 stephan Remove unnecessary jclass-type struct members.

2023-08-23 stephan Add a note to the JNI README explaining why the Java API has callback names like xFunc() and xPreUpdate().

2023-08-23 stephan Bind sqlite3_preupdate_hook() and friends to JNI.

2023-08-23 stephan Bind a subset of sqlite3_config() to JNI: threading modes and sqllog.

2023-08-23 stephan Numerous minor cleanups and code style conformance improvements.

2023-08-23 stephan Improve C-side exception handling from Java-side UDF callbacks.

2023-08-22 stephan Minor Tester1.java cleanups.

2023-08-22 stephan Fix Tester1 so that exceptions triggered via threads are not silently ignored. Disable auto-extension tests in multi-thread mode because concurrent threads rightfully interfere with that.

2023-08-22 stephan More work on the JNI multi-threaded test runner.

2023-08-22 stephan Disassociate JNI db handles from the thread that created them, as it's no longer relevant.

2023-08-22 stephan Correct JNI binding of sqlite3_shutdown() to clean up all cached JNIEnv objects.

2023-08-22 stephan JNI internal cleanups and correct two leaked db handles in test code.

2023-08-22 stephan Move the JNI per-thread cache of NativePointerHolder refs into global space. This allows better-targeted mutex locks and incidentally eliminates the lagginess and post-run hangs in Tester1's multi-thread mode (presumably caused by deadlocks).

2023-08-22 stephan Move most of the per-JNIEnv global Java class refs into the global state, saving a bit of per-thread overhead.

2023-08-21 stephan Minor JNI cleanups.

2023-08-19 stephan JNI cleanups.

2023-08-19 stephan JNI doc additions.

2023-08-19 stephan JNI test code cleanups.

2023-08-19 stephan Minor JNI cleanups.

2023-08-19 stephan Add multi-thread run mode to JNI Tester1. It works but hangs on exit sometimes for Java reasons as yet not understood.

2023-08-19 stephan Replace JNI::NewStringUTF() for the remaining cases where output may be incompatible with MUTF-8. It is now only used when we know the output to be plain ASCII.

2023-08-18 stephan Improve exception handling in OpfsDb.importDb().

2023-08-18 stephan Extend the importDb() method of both OPFS VFSes to (A) support reading in an async streaming fashion via a callback and (B) automatically disable WAL mode in the imported db.

2023-08-17 stephan Remove some obsolete JNI-internal docs.

2023-08-17 stephan Tighten up the JNI auto-ext handling.

2023-08-17 stephan Minor internal JNI cleanups and fixes.

2023-08-17 stephan Remove the FIXME markers related to threading. Code style cleanups.

2023-08-17 stephan Add SQLITE_EXTRA_AUTOEXT, similar to SQLITE_EXTRA_INIT but adds a builtin auto-extension provided by the client. Suggestion from [forum:00829394c74a670f| forum post 00829394c74a670f].

2023-08-15 stephan Add note about the current threading limitation to ext/jni/README.md. No code changes.

2023-08-15 stephan Minor reshaping of Tester1 moving towards making a multi-threaded run mode.

2023-08-15 stephan Remove a piece of stray debug output. No functional changes.

2023-08-14 stephan Bring handling of the Java auto-ext handler more in line with the core in terms of locking and mutability during traversal. This removes the explicit synchronous requirement from the Java open() and auto-ext bindings.

2023-08-14 stephan Remove some obsolete, commented-out makefile code. No functional or build changes.

2023-08-14 stephan More work on the JNI-specific mutexes. Rework the NativePointerHolder cache lookup to be slightly simpler and O(1) instead of O(N).

2023-08-14 stephan JNI-internal docs and removal of obsolete code.

2023-08-13 stephan Internal API renaming for clarity's sake.

2023-08-13 stephan Add a mutex for auto-extensions, tied in to the open() process since that's the route into auto-extensions.

2023-08-13 stephan Add some docs and metrics for the new mutex internals.

2023-08-13 stephan An initial attempt at protecting the JNI global state via mutexes at the C level instead of relying on Java's synchronized keyword. It seems to work but increases the run time of the single-threaded batch tester by roughly 3 times.

2023-08-12 stephan Bind sqlite3_interrupt() and sqlite3_is_interrupted() to JNI but with caveats regarding mutexing of the JNIEnv cache. Add a loud warning to the JNI 'dist' target that it should be built with JDK8 (a.k.a. Java 1.8) for compatibility reasons.

entry.title: [TabDragDrop] Avoid triggering reorder mode twice for tab drag
entry.content:
Avoid triggering reorder mode twice for tab drag.

-Previously, we triggered on long-press, canceled when the drag event

started, then re-triggered when the drag enter event was passed.

-When tab drag is enabled, we skip starting reorder mode on long-press,

and instead wait on the subsequent drag event to trigger it instead.

entry.title: Shared Storage: Browser PermissionsPolicy check for headers
entry.content:
We pay down some tech debt by adding a browser-side

`PermissionsPolicy` check for the

`blink::mojom::PermissionsPolicyFeature::kSharedStorage` feature

in the cases where the initial check was done by the renderer.



For the iframe navigation case, however, since the initial

permissions policy check for shared storage writing from an iframe

navigation request already occurs in the browser process in

`NavigationRequest`, it's not absolutely necessary to do a double

check, and so if we are unable to perform one due to not being able

to obtain the parent policy, we skip the check and proceed with the

operation(s). Whereas, in non-navigation-initiated cases, if we are

unable to perform the check, we drop any operation(s).



While we're at it, we pass in the `NavigationOrDocumentHandle` to

`SharedStorageHeaderObserver::HeaderReceived()` instead of the

`RenderFrameHost`, and add a method

`NavigationOrDocumentHandle::GetTopFrameOrigin()`, to try to avoid

having to create a new opaque origin for the user profile preferences

check in the case when a `RenderFrameHost` is not available to help us

access the main frame's last committed origin.



We also add a couple of metrics related to the above.



Note that in "SharedStorageHeaderObserverTest", we swap out the

`ContentBrowserClient` for a derived `MockContentBrowserClient`

instance to control the return value of

`MockContentBrowserClient::IsSharedStorageAllowed()`.



Bug: 1434529,1218540

Change-Id: I7020626511215bbfc1972e6a3fddef5432b95cd1

entry.title: H264 Rate Controller with intra frame processing functionality
entry.content:
The class provides support for up to two temporal layers, each with

its own HRD buffer. The video stream parameters are described using

the Controller Settings structure. In the current implementation, the

controller estimates the QP parameter for the intra encoded frames.

entry.title: Reland "Use language subtags when searching for language packs to install"
entry.content:
Original change's description:

> Revert "Use language subtags when searching for language packs to install"

>

> This reverts commit 156f2387863af0c13735f94f690f3e99670731c0.

>

> Reason for revert:

> LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5690146202583040

>

> Sample build with failed test: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8761586936020355377

> Affected test(s):

> [ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/LiveCaptionAutomaticLanguageDownloadTest.AutomaticLanguageDownload](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest:browser_tests%2FLiveCaptionAutomaticLanguageDownloadTest.AutomaticLanguageDownload?q=VHash%3A6d0a43807ac672d9)

>

> If this is a false positive, please report it at http://b.corp.google.com/createIssue?component=1199205&description=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Ftest-analysis%2Fb%2F5690146202583040&format=PLAIN&priority=P3&title=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5120976&type=BUG

>

> Original change's description:

> > Use language subtags when searching for language packs to install

> >

> > This CL updates the Live Caption to use language subtags when searching

> > for language packs to install. The language identification feature

> > returns a specific locale (i.e. "es-US"), but the Live Caption feature

> > on Mac/Windows/Linux only has one language pack per language.

> >

entry.title: Add more shards to interactive_ui_tests_no_field_trial on win-rel
entry.content:
The suite has a ~50min cycle time on one shard on CI:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Win10%20Tests%20x64/86551/overview



And on try, that suite is expiring consistently on CLs that set

"Include-Ci-Only-Tests: true":

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/win-rel/448213/overview

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/win-rel/448791/overview



Try's addition of DCHECKs might be bumping the suite past the 60min

timeout. So this adds 4 shards to it, which should fix the tryjobs, as

well as making the CI bot cycle much more quickly.



Ignore-Freeze: true

Bug: None

Change-Id: Ie841a2e2ee287f20ebec969a24434d2dfda3e7d7

entry.title: IDB: add/improve some performance metrics.
entry.content:
The long-existing Transaction.*.TimeActive metric starts measuring from

when a transaction "starts" and stops measuring when it's half way

through committing, i.e. when done writing blobs (if any), but not done

with the LevelDB commit. Not clear if this was intentional, but it's

being replaced by `TimeActive2` which measures until after the LevelDB

commit finishes, which should better capture differences between

backing stores (e.g. LevelDB vs SQLite) as well as the effects of

relaxed durability.



A new renderer metric is added that measures the time taken to open a

database, which can either be establishing a new connection to an

existing database or creating a new database. This is an important

aspect of read performance which the `ObjectStoreGet` metric fails to

measure since it doesn't start measuring until the transaction is

already active. `open` delays could be affected by IDB thread

contention (crbug.com/1474996) or database lock contention, i.e.

those resources guarded by PartitionedLockManager; relaxing

durability should generally shorten the duration for which locks are

held, so hopefully this metric demonstrates a difference in that

experiment.



A new browser metric, Transaction.*.TimeQueued, measures the time

spent in the transaction queue before starting. Like the new renderer

metric, this should capture "traffic jams" from lock or thread

contention.



Bug: 1474996,965883,1429650

Change-Id: I90c73e5eade72d2f183998729203ce1aa9fc241a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5136998

entry.title: Finish draining SpdySession when all active streams receive END_STREAM
entry.content:
When a SpdySession with active streams receives a GO_AWAY frame, it

waits for all active streams to close before terminating.

Prior to this CL, the SpdySession could stall after all streams were

closed if the peer didn't close the underlying TCP connection.



To prevent the SpdySession from stalling, terminate the SpdySession

when all active streams are closed.



Some SpdyNetworkTransactionTests are updated as SpdySession

termination no longer requires EOF.



Bug: 1510327

as opposed to document level semantics (for example, we don't use it

entry.title: Improve Blink pretty-printing for WTF containers
entry.content:
Fixes HashTable printing since, currently:



* It assumes the table is KeyValue, which is not the case when used from

HashSet. HashSet uses simply uses the Value as the Key and doesn't

store a pair.

* Assumes the key has an "impl_" field. I'm assuming this was to deal

with Member pointers but even these no longer have an impl_ field.



This change determines the key-extraction method based on the table's

template arguments. Also dereference a Member key correctly, ensuring a

compressed pointer is decompressed first.



Additionally, improves pretty-printing in both HashTable and Vector

containers by dereferencing Member-type pointers in output.



Change-Id: I8aae17984a0683e24d7c28b2a553de1c8d66cb77

entry.title: [A11y] Partial revert to fix crash when finding <option> parent
entry.content:
Partial revert of CL:5123413. Remove NOTREACHED() and restore comment.



This condition is rare, but can occur if a is first created, there is

no layout object, and a generic AXObject (not AXMenuList) is

created. The autofill code can call in just at the right time to

request this parent, and hits the NOTREACHED().



Test: this crash occurs when loading clock.laplace.live, or by loading the included test in the browser. It's unclear why, but the test does

not crash when running as a web test.



Note that these AXMenuList* classes will be going away in favor

of a generic implementation based on the shadow DOM, using ordinary

AXNodeObjects.



Fixed: 1512999

entry.content:
Leverages a prototype extension to return polygonal bounds. Note that it

appears as though the bounds reported by this extension are returned

counter-clockwise, when the API needs clockwise, so they are reversed

entry.title: Convert the message_pipe.js "system lib" to TypeScript
entry.content:
This is library code consumed by chrome[-untrusted]://{media,help}-app.



To unblock full TypeScript conversion of these 4 consumers

(plus tests), message_pipe.ts must exist. But tsc will not generate

closure types, so a basic externs file is created so that JS clients

can consume the `tsc` JS output, but still run closure typechecks

using the externs file. Once the consumers are TypeScript (hopefully

soon), this externs file can be deleted.



TypeScript consumers of message_pipe can now use the .ts directly

rather than generating a .d.ts from the closure-annotated .js.



rollup targets need a new `external_paths` entry because the ash+

system_app specific dir is not in the list that bundle_js.gni provides.



`ts_library` targets need a `path_mappings` entry for message_pipe

because the ash+system_app specific dir is not in this list that

path_mappings.py has hardcoded. (color_change_listener is here, so

the entry media_app_ui:build_ts had was not in use, and incorrect).



Bug: b/314827247

entry.title: [Tab Organization] Fix inverted sensitivity score.
entry.content:
The content annotation service computes a visibility score, where 1 is 'most confident this is safe to make visible'; the trigger sensitivity logic wants a score where 1 is 'most confident this is sensitive'. For now I just flipped the score.



This CL also fixes a crash with the trigger demo mode when clicking the organize tabs button. The demo mode didn't keep the BackoffLevelProvider alive, so the service segfaulted when updating the backoff level.

entry.title: scanning: Verify scanner connectivity when getting the list
entry.content:
When the list of scanners is being retrieved, certain scanners (USB

ones, for instance) are known to be reachable via their connection

string. Others are not known to be reachable. For those, verify that

they are reachable before returning them in the list of available

scanners by attempting to open a connection to that scanner.



Bug: b:315974991
